medical_history.chief_complaint: Bipolar disorder with episodes of mania and depression.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Ms G experienced her first manic episode at age 15 after the loss of her mother. Her manic episodes began in the summer of 1998, leading to two inpatient hospitalizations due to symptoms such as hopelessness, difficulty sleeping, emotional lability, decreased appetite, and decreased energy. These episodes led to increased agitation, resulting in a second inpatient stay following medication discontinuation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of bipolar disorder with two manic episodes resulting in hospitalization. Major depressive episodes have occurred, leading to the initiation of bupropion treatment.
medical_history.family_history: History of mental illness is absent in first-degree relatives. Her mother died of cancer at age 15, and her aunt died by suicide.
medical_history.social_history: Ms G lives with her boyfriend, occasionally drinks alcohol, smokes cigarettes, and has lost medical insurance, complicating her access to treatment.
